entry.summary: Iran continues to seek Israel's destruction, Netanyahu says.

entry.title: The Latest: Thumbs down on Iran deal by several GOP hopefuls
entry.summary: Benjamin Netanyahu says the world is now a "much more dangerous place" and criticized Tuesday's agreement as a "stunning historic mistake."

entry.title: The Latest: Congress expected to take up nuclear deal soon
entry.summary:
Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that an accord with Iran will allow it "to continue to pursue its aggression and terror in the region."

Netanyahu has been at the forefront of efforts to block an agreement that would lift sanctions on Iran.

entry.title: Iran deal a 'bad mistake of historic proportions' says Netanyahu
Israeli exhibit revisits famed 1976 Entebbe raid in which Netanyahu's brother was killed
entry.summary:
Yonatan Netanyahu, brother of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

Yonatan Netanyahu, the commander of the commando unit that led the raid, was shot dead as he was helping the Israeli hostages who had been held inside the airport's old terminal back onto the plane.

At the exhibit's opening Thursday, Netanyahu was visibly emotional as he spoke of his brother, calling the exhibit "something special."

entry.title: Israeli leader says world 'caving' into Iran at nuke talks
entry.summary:
Responding to the Iranian supreme leader's call to continue the struggle against the United States regardless of the outcome of nuclear talks, Benjamin Netanyahu says Sunday his country will not accept such a reality.

Netanyahu says that Iran "does not hide its intentions" and warned the world against placating it.

entry.title: The Latest: Netanyahu says Israel working to release men
entry.summary: In a statement Thursday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he spoke to the family of one of the men, an Israeli Ethiopian, telling them he "has not spared any effort" to return the man to Israel.

entry.title: Israel's Netanyahu Says Better Iran Deal Still Possible
entry.summary: Benjamin Netanyahu told a graduating class of pilots Thursday that "it is still not too late to insist on a good deal."

entry.title: Netanyahu rejects French-led Palestine peace plan
entry.summary:
"In the international proposals that have been suggested to us - which they are actually trying to force upon us - there is no real reference to Israel's security needs or our other national interests," Mr Netanyahu said.

"The only way to reach agreements is through bilateral negotiations [between Israel and Palestine], and we will firmly reject attempts to force international dictates on us," Mr Netanyahu said.

entry.title: Israel's Netanyahu says better Iran deal still possible
entry.summary: Netanyahu has dubbed it a "bad deal," saying it would leave Iran with the ability to rapidly obtain nuclear weapons.

entry.title: Netanyahu gives cool reception to French peace initiative
Netanyahu gives cool reception to French peace initiative
entry.summary:
Benjamin Netanyahu made the remarks ahead of a visit by French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius.

Netanyahu said that attacks against Israelis will continue with any international proposal that does not take Israel's security concerns into account.

entry.title: Israel's Netanyahu Criticizes Upcoming UN Report On Gaza War
entry.summary:
JERUSALEM (AP) - Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday criticized an upcoming United Nations report into last year's war in the Gaza Strip, calling it a waste of time.

"Those who want to know the truth should read this report and read the report of the top generals," Netanyahu told his Cabinet.
